content: the grand marais hat i grew up knitting this hat up in grand marais minnesota way back in the 70 s it is a very warm soft light hat that just stays in place and keeps your ears warm we called it the grand marais hat and it was much loved the yarn shop tall tales distributed this pattern for free it is i believe an adaption of an out-of-print lopi pattern i offer it free here just the way my mom wrote it down on a tiny piece of paper we managed to not lose from all those years ago well ok i did add a few more details please enjoy yarn reynold s lopi 2 skeins for a one or two color hat cast on 60 stitches join into the round though it is also done in three colors you could do the being careful not to twist the stitches hat in around 150 yards of any bulky weight row 1 knit needles double pointed and 16 circular size 10 i grew row 2 purl up knitting it just on the double pointed needles but it repeat these two row a total of 18 to 22 does have a tendancy to fall off the needles the circular times to creat the folded brim needles would eliminate that problem switch colors gauge approx 3 stitches per inch over garter stitch knit 14 to 20 row depending on head size finished size the finished hat fits a size medium to large adult i will include a few notes at the end about continued on back resizing chame le katie o n ©katie chameleon 2010 all rights reserved contact katie@katiechameleon com switch colors *k8 k2 decrease* 6 times *k7 k2 decrease* 6 times *k6 k2 decrease* 6 times *k5 k2 decrease* 6 times *k4 k2 decrease* 6 times *k3 k2 decrease* 6 times *k2 k2 decrease* 6 times *k1 k2 decrease* 6 times *k2 decrease* 6 times run a thread through the remaining 6 stitches and pull tight work in all the loose ends wear sizing notes for an adult small cast on 54 stitches knit the for a child s size make up in lopi lite or a heavy same as the adult large except omit the worsted on size 6-8 needles and adjust depth as is *k8 k2 decrease* 6 times row appropriate questions problems comments please feel free to contact me katie@katiechameleon com or ktvknits on ravelry com copyright details this pattern is to be distributed for no cost you may copy this pattern for your own use just don t sell it an individual knitter may knit this item to sell but may not claim the design as their own i need to be given credit for the pattern and any inquiries about the pattern should be sent my way any companies wishing to contract this pattern please contact me
